alert.note: Alert for South Laramie Range; South Laramie Range Foothills (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 28 at 3:29PM MDT by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of eastern Albany and west central Laramie Counties through 400 PM MDT... At 329 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near North Crow Campground, or 13 miles east of Laramie, moving southeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... North Crow Campground, Granite Springs Reservoir, Federal, Granite Springs Campground, Crystal Lake Reservoir, Crystal Lake Campground and Buford. This includes Interstate 80 in Wyoming between mile markers 333 and 336. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: South Laramie Range; South Laramie Range Foothills
